verbose_text: Knocking down ULK1 by ULK1-siRNA in HCCs, the level of LicA induced LC3 II was significant lower than co-siRNA, but still higher than DMSO treatment (XREF_FIG), similarly, staining with AO, the red fluorescence intensity was significant lower than co-siRNA, but still higher than DMSO treatment (XREF_FIG), thus ULK1 / Atg13 complex is one of the regulating molecules of LicA induced autophagy, not the unique regulating molecule.
